docs.abstract: Investors returned, and futures indicated a rise on Wall Street, a day after coronavirus fears and oil market disruptions caused the biggest sell-off in a decade.
docs.snippet: Investors returned, and futures indicated a rise on Wall Street, a day after coronavirus fears and oil market disruptions caused the biggest sell-off in a decade.
docs.lead_paragraph: This briefing is no longer live. Updates can be found here.

headline.main: Stocks Climb as Investors Look to Washington

docs.abstract: Officials from JPMorgan, Bank of America and other institutions will gather Wednesday at the White House to discuss help for businesses.
docs.snippet: Officials from JPMorgan, Bank of America and other institutions will gather Wednesday at the White House to discuss help for businesses.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the markets rage and more businesses reel from the impact of the spreading coronavirus, President Trump plans to meet with officials from the nation’s banks at the White House on Wednesday afternoon.

headline.main: Trump to Meet Bank Executives Amid Market Turmoil
headline.print_headline: Trump Plans Meeting With Bank Executives Amid Market Turmoil

byline.original: By Kate Kelly and Jeanna Smialek

docs.abstract: Policymakers can’t prevent economic damage from the outbreak, but they can limit it and make a quick rebound more likely.
docs.snippet: Policymakers can’t prevent economic damage from the outbreak, but they can limit it and make a quick rebound more likely.
docs.lead_paragraph: The government can’t prevent the coronavirus from damaging the U.S. economy.

headline.main: Economic Prescription for Coronavirus: ‘You’ve Got to Go Fast’
headline.print_headline: To Mend Economy, ‘You’ve Got To Go Fast’

docs.abstract: Days after two board members resigned under pressure, the bank’s new leader told House members that Wells Fargo is urgently focused on appeasing its regulators.
docs.snippet: Days after two board members resigned under pressure, the bank’s new leader told House members that Wells Fargo is urgently focused on appeasing its regulators.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the chief executive of Wells Fargo, Charles W. Scharf, appeared before the House Financial Services Committee on Tuesday, the committee’s chairwoman opened with an ominous warning: The last two Wells Fargo chiefs to face Capitol Hill inquisitions resigned soon after.

headline.main: Latest Wells Fargo Chief Promises to Reform ‘Broken’ Culture
headline.print_headline: Wells Fargo Chief Visits Capitol Hill, Promising Reform

docs.abstract: Oil producers in the United States and other nations brace for lower revenue, reduced investment and job losses as a global glut is compounded.
docs.snippet: Oil producers in the United States and other nations brace for lower revenue, reduced investment and job losses as a global glut is compounded.
docs.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — The sudden upheaval in the oil markets may claim victims around the world, from energy companies and their workers to governments whose budgets are pegged to the price of crude.

headline.main: Saudi Oil Price Cut Is a Market Shock With Wide Tremors
headline.print_headline: Fuel Industry Risks Bankruptcies And Layoffs in Abrupt Downturn

docs.abstract: A new system uses software to dictate quarantines — and appears to send personal data to police, in a troubling precedent for automated social control.
docs.snippet: A new system uses software to dictate quarantines — and appears to send personal data to police, in a troubling precedent for automated social control.
docs.lead_paragraph: HANGZHOU, China — As China encourages people to return to work despite the coronavirus outbreak, it has begun a bold mass experiment in using data to regulate citizens’ lives — by requiring them to use software on their smartphones that dictates whether they should be quarantined or allowed into subways, malls and other public spaces.

headline.main: In Coronavirus Fight, China Gives Citizens a Color Code, With Red Flags
headline.print_headline: In China, Color-Coded Data Raises Red Flags

byline.original: By Paul Mozur, Raymond Zhong and Aaron Krolik

docs.abstract: For the first time, Twitter applied its policy against fake and misleading videos and labeled one.
docs.snippet: For the first time, Twitter applied its policy against fake and misleading videos and labeled one.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A manipulated video featuring Joseph R. Biden Jr. and spread by President Trump over the weekend has ratcheted up an online war that has put Twitter and Facebook in the middle of a debate over political speech.

headline.main: Manipulated Biden Video Escalates Online Speech War With Trump
headline.print_headline: Doctored Biden Video Causes Twitter Uproar

docs.abstract: The Trump administration’s 30-day ban on most travelers from Continental Europe because of the coronavirus has dealt a fresh blow to the industry. Norwegian will temporarily halve its staff.
docs.snippet: The Trump administration’s 30-day ban on most travelers from Continental Europe because of the coronavirus has dealt a fresh blow to the industry. Norwegian will temporarily halve its staff.
docs.lead_paragraph: Airlines around the world on Thursday scrambled to cancel flights, lay off workers and reassure anxious travelers, capping a dizzying period of weeks in which bookings have evaporated and investors have lost confidence in the industry.

headline.main: Airlines Cancel Flights and Lay Off Workers as Stocks Plummet
headline.print_headline: Airlines Reel, Axing Staff And Flights

docs.abstract: Investors and clients of the facial recognition start-up freely used the app on dates and at parties — and to spy on the public.
docs.snippet: Investors and clients of the facial recognition start-up freely used the app on dates and at parties — and to spy on the public.
docs.lead_paragraph: One Tuesday night in October 2018, John Catsimatidis, the billionaire owner of the Gristedes grocery store chain, was having dinner at Cipriani, an upscale Italian restaurant in Manhattan’s SoHo neighborhood, when his daughter, Andrea, walked in. She was on a date with a man Mr. Catsimatidis didn’t recognize. After the couple sat down at another table, Mr. Catsimatidis asked a waiter to go over and take a photo.

headline.main: Before Clearview Became a Police Tool, It Was a Secret Plaything of the Rich
headline.print_headline: Before Clearview Became a Police Tool, It Was a Secret Plaything of the Rich

docs.abstract: In locked-down cities like Wuhan, isolated seniors and disabled people have largely had to fend for themselves.
docs.snippet: In locked-down cities like Wuhan, isolated seniors and disabled people have largely had to fend for themselves.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lucifer Zhang, who is deaf and cannot speak, was able to get by on her $140 monthly stipend from the government. Then China locked down her home city, Wuhan, in late January to contain the coronavirus outbreak.

headline.main: In Coronavirus Fight, China’s Vulnerable Fall Through the Cracks
headline.print_headline: Quarantines Further Push China’s Poor Into Distress
